oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Confederate soldier John Lafayette Lemonds
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Writing to his future wife M. [Ellen] McCorkle from New Madrid near Island No. 10, 1st Lt. John L. Lemonds of Co. C, 5th Inf. CSA speaks of the Confederates' evacuation of Columbus, Ky. necessitated by Gen. Albert S. Johnston's falling back from Bowling; Green, Ky. Talks of getting aboard a steamboat for New Madrid after "we left almost the whole town in flames" and abandoned most of their stores, "a scene which I shall never forget."
